title: CLM Maturity Self-Assessment
description: Evaluate your organization's contract lifecycle management maturity

pages.name: introduction
pages.title: Welcome to the CLM Self-Assessment Survey

elements.name: intro_html
elements.description:
Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) Maturity Assessment

This comprehensive assessment will help you evaluate your organization's contract management maturity across six critical stages:

  • Stage 1: e-Document - Digital document management capabilities
  • Stage 2: e-Signature - Electronic signature integration
  • Stage 3: Contract Workflow Automation - Automated processes and workflows
  • Stage 4: Contract Authoring Automation - Template and clause management
  • Stage 5: Contract Intelligence - Analytics and insights
  • Stage 6: Contract Execution - Performance monitoring and integration

Each question uses a 1-5 rating scale where:

  • 1 = No capability or very limited functionality
  • 2 = Basic capability with significant limitations
  • 3 = Moderate capability with some automation
  • 4 = Good capability with reliable automation
  • 5 = Advanced capability with comprehensive automation

Your responses will be saved automatically as you progress through the survey.

elements.name: company_name
elements.title: Company Name

elements.name: email
elements.title: Email Address
elements.description: We'll use this to save your progress and send you the results

elements.name: name
elements.title: Your Name (Optional)

elements.name: role
elements.title: Your Role (Optional)

elements.name: stage1_centralized_contract_repository_1
elements.title: How effectively does your organization maintain a centralized repository where all contracts are accessible to authorized personnel, regardless of storage platform?

choices.text: No centralized repository; contracts stored in various locations with no systematic organization
Basic shared storage location exists but with limited organization and accessibility issues
Centralized repository exists with basic search but incomplete contract coverage
Well-organized repository with most contracts accessible and searchable by authorized users
Comprehensive repository with flexible indexing, complete contract coverage, and role-based access controls

elements.name: stage1_document_classification_and_tagging_2
elements.title: To what extent have you implemented user-defined metadata that aligns with your organizational standards to enhance contract retrieval and analysis?

choices.text: No systematic tagging or classification system
Basic document types identified but limited metadata applied inconsistently
Standardized classification scheme with moderate consistency in application
Comprehensive metadata framework consistently applied to most contracts
Robust user-defined metadata system fully aligned with organizational standards, enabling advanced retrieval and analysis

elements.name: stage1_audit_trails_and_document_history_3
elements.title: How comprehensive are your audit logs for tracking all contract-related activities, and can they be easily downloaded for compliance purposes?

choices.text: No audit capabilities or very limited change tracking
Basic version history without user attribution or comprehensive activity logs
Moderate audit capabilities capturing major changes with limited reporting
Comprehensive activity tracking with user attribution and standard reports
Complete, downloadable detailed logs for all activities with custom reporting for regulatory compliance

elements.name: stage1_bulk_contract_import_and_export_4
elements.title: Does your system effectively handle large-volume contract imports with AI-powered analysis and data extraction capabilities?

choices.text: Manual contract import only; no bulk capabilities
Basic bulk upload but requires extensive manual processing afterward
Bulk import with semi-automated data extraction requiring significant manual verification
Efficient bulk import with good automated data extraction and moderate accuracy
AI-powered bulk import with high-quality automated analysis and data extraction requiring minimal manual intervention

elements.name: stage2_e_signature_capability_or_integration_1
elements.title: How seamlessly does your system integrate with e-Signature providers to facilitate contract closure and negotiation?

choices.text: No e-Signature capabilities; paper-based signatures only
Basic e-Signature capabilities but disconnected from contract management system
Functional integration with one e-Signature provider with manual data synchronization
Good integration with major e-Signature providers with automated status updates
Seamless integration with multiple e-Signature providers, supporting complex signing workflows and complete visibility

elements.name: stage3_customizable_approvals_workflows_1
elements.title: How effectively can your team configure no-code approval workflows that align with your organization's unique needs, including tracking, reporting, and notifications?

choices.text: No standardized approval workflows; ad-hoc email-based approvals
Basic predefined workflows with limited customization
Moderately customizable workflows requiring technical assistance
Good no-code workflow configuration with role-based assignments and notifications
Highly flexible, no-code workflow capability with comprehensive tracking, reporting, and multi-channel alerts

elements.name: stage3_renewals_management_2
elements.title: To what extent does your system automate renewal workflows, monitor renegotiation needs, and alert teams to avoid missed deadlines?

choices.text: No renewal tracking; entirely manual process
Basic calendar reminders without workflow integration
Systematic renewal date tracking with manual workflow initiation
Automated renewal alerts with semi-automated workflow initiation
Fully automated, user-configurable renewal workflows with advance monitoring, timely alerts, and automated renegotiation initiation

elements.name: stage3_contract_review_and_negotiation_3
elements.title: How well does your system support multi-participant review and negotiation across different storage mechanisms while maintaining confidential internal communications?

choices.text: Email-based review and negotiation without system support
Basic document sharing capabilities but limited collaboration features
Moderate collaboration tools with some version control but limited confidentiality controls
Good collaborative review with version control and basic internal commenting
Comprehensive multi-participant review across storage platforms with robust confidential messaging and negotiation tracking

elements.name: stage3_third_party_contract_management_4
elements.title: How seamlessly can your system onboard, analyze, and manage third-party contracts, including risk assessment and clause analysis?

choices.text: No specific third-party contract capabilities; managed same as internal contracts
Basic storage of third-party contracts with minimal analysis
Standardized intake process with manual analysis and risk assessment
Good automated intake with basic AI-assisted analysis
Seamless AI-enhanced onboarding with comprehensive risk, compliance, and clause analysis

elements.name: stage3_risk_scoring_and_compliance_management_5
elements.title: To what extent does your system provide risk scoring and compliance monitoring to identify potential issues and ensure regulatory adherence?

choices.text: No systematic risk assessment or compliance monitoring
Basic manual risk assessment without consistent methodology or systematic compliance checks
Standardized risk assessment and compliance methodology but manually applied with limited tracking
Automated risk scoring and compliance checks based on predefined rules with regular monitoring
Advanced risk modeling with configurable scoring algorithms, automated compliance verification, and proactive regulatory monitoring

elements.name: stage3_template_and_clause_standardization_6
elements.title: How effectively does your system implement standardized templates and clause standardization to limit inconsistency risks and ensure uniformity across contracts?

choices.text: No standardized templates or clauses; each contract created uniquely
Basic templates exist but with minimal enforcement and frequent custom modifications
Standard templates with moderate clause control but inconsistent usage across departments
Well-defined template and clause library with good adoption and consistency across most contract types
Comprehensive template and clause standardization with automated enforcement, version control, and complete organizational adoption

elements.name: stage4_redlining_and_collaboration_1
elements.title: To what extent does your system offer AI-enhanced redlining capabilities that accelerate negotiations while maintaining appropriate access controls?

choices.text: No system redlining capabilities; using external word processing tools
Basic document comparison without intelligent assistance
Standard redlining capabilities with version tracking but minimal AI enhancement
Good AI-assisted redlining with clause suggestions and version control
Advanced AI-enhanced redlining with intelligent alternatives, negotiation acceleration, and sophisticated access controls

elements.name: stage4_automated_contract_creation_2
elements.title: How well does your system support user-friendly contract requests with automatic creation based on dynamic, configurable, AI-enriched templates?

choices.text: Manual contract drafting with no automation
Basic templates requiring significant manual adjustment
Standard templates with limited dynamic content
Good template system with conditional clauses and basic automation
Fully automated contract creation with user-friendly interfaces, dynamic AI-enriched templates, and no-code configuration capabilities

elements.name: stage4_contract_clause_library_3
elements.title: To what degree have you implemented an AI-enhanced library of standard and fallback clauses that can be easily maintained and configured?

choices.text: No formal clause library; clauses copied from existing contracts
Basic collection of standard clauses without systematic organization
Organized clause library with manual selection and implementation
Good clause management with categorization and moderate AI assistance
Comprehensive AI-enhanced clause library with automated suggestions, fallback options, and easy maintenance

elements.name: stage4_contract_templates_4
elements.title: How effectively does your organization create and configure templates with multi-variable logic to include or exclude standard and fallback clauses?

choices.text: No standardized templates; contracts created from scratch or previous examples
Basic static templates with minimal logic
Standard templates with some variable fields but limited conditional logic
Good template system with moderate conditional logic capabilities
Sophisticated user-configurable templates with multi-variable logic for dynamic clause inclusion/exclusion and fallback options

elements.name: stage4_contract_authoring_5
elements.title: How comprehensively does your system support dynamic, AI-enhanced template utilization and no-code configurable workflows for new contract creation?

choices.text: Manual authoring with limited system support
Basic document creation tools with minimal intelligence
Template-based authoring with some workflow support but limited AI assistance
Good AI-supported authoring with standard workflows
Comprehensive dynamic, AI-enhanced authoring with fully configurable no-code workflows ensuring consistency and speed

elements.name: stage4_contract_obligations_analysis_6
elements.title: How comprehensively does your system analyze obligations across all contracts to enable sophisticated scenario planning?

choices.text: No systematic obligations analysis
Basic manual tracking of key obligations
Standardized obligation identification with limited cross-contract analysis
Good automated obligation extraction with basic scenario analysis
Comprehensive AI-enhanced obligation analysis across the entire contract portfolio enabling sophisticated scenario planning

elements.name: stage4_contract_entitlements_analysis_7
elements.title: To what extent does your system provide AI-enhanced analysis and comparison of entitlements across your entire contract portfolio?

choices.text: No systematic entitlements analysis
Manual identification of basic entitlements
Standardized entitlement extraction with limited cross-contract comparison
Good automated entitlement identification with basic comparison capabilities
Advanced AI-enhanced analysis and comparison of entitlements across the entire contract portfolio

elements.name: stage4_self_service_contracting_8
elements.title: How effectively does your system provide simple interfaces for non-Legal users to request, monitor, and access contracts and negotiations?

choices.text: No self-service capabilities; all requests through legal department
Basic request forms but limited visibility into status
Standardized request process with status updates but limited access to documents
Good self-service portal with request tracking and document access
Comprehensive self-service interfaces allowing non-legal users to easily request, monitor status, and access appropriate contract documents

elements.name: stage4_versioning_and_change_management_9
elements.title: How systematically does your organization track, store, and manage contract revisions and updates throughout their lifecycle?

choices.text: No formal versioning; difficult to determine current version
Basic manual version control with limited historical tracking
Systematic version tracking but with manual processes for updates
Automated version control with clear history and change tracking
Comprehensive version management with automatic tracking, comparison capabilities, and full lifecycle documentation

elements.name: stage5_contract_reporting_analytics_1
elements.title: How effectively does your system provide configurable reports and dashboards to surface data, trends, and opportunities for process improvement?

choices.text: No systematic reporting capabilities
Basic predefined reports with minimal customization
Standard reporting with some configuration options
Good reporting tools with user-configurable dashboards
Comprehensive no-code configurable reporting and analytics with sophisticated dashboards highlighting data trends and improvement opportunities

elements.name: stage5_contract_risk_scoring_2
elements.title: To what degree have you implemented AI-enhanced, configurable risk scoring based on both industry standards and internal requirements?

choices.text: No risk scoring capabilities
Basic manual risk assessment without consistent methodology
Standardized risk assessment methodology but manually applied
Automated risk scoring based on predefined rules with limited configurability
AI-enhanced risk scoring that's fully configurable, incorporating both industry standards and internal requirements

elements.name: stage5_contract_digitization_3
elements.title: How effectively does your system automate the ingestion and digitization of contracts with AI-enhanced data analysis, review, and extraction?

choices.text: Manual data entry from paper contracts
Basic document scanning with minimal data extraction
Standardized digitization process with semi-automated data extraction
Good automated ingestion with reliable data extraction
Advanced AI-enhanced digitization with high-quality data analysis, comprehensive review, and accurate extraction

elements.name: stage5_automated_contract_review_4
elements.title: How effectively does your system use AI to identify and extract key data, perform initial risk and compliance reviews, and suggest standardized language alternatives?

choices.text: Entirely manual contract review
Basic checklist-driven review without AI assistance
Semi-automated review with limited data extraction
Good AI-assisted review with reliable data extraction and basic risk identification
Comprehensive AI-enriched contract review with advanced data extraction, thorough risk and compliance assessment, and intelligent language suggestions

elements.name: stage5_advanced_search_filtering_5
elements.title: How comprehensive are your system's search capabilities in meeting different user needs and exposing contract data to authorized personnel?

choices.text: Basic filename search only
Full-text search with limited filtering options
Standard search with moderate filtering by common metadata
Advanced search with good filtering options and saved search capabilities
Comprehensive search capabilities with multiple options, advanced filtering, and personalized search experiences for different user needs

elements.name: stage5_spend_cost_analysis_6
elements.title: How effectively is your contract system integrated with financial systems to analyze spending effectiveness?

choices.text: No integration between contract and financial systems
Manual export/import between systems with limited analysis
Basic integration with standard financial reports
Good integration with moderate spend analysis capabilities
Seamless integration with comprehensive spend and cost analysis capabilities

elements.name: stage5_obligations_management_7
elements.title: How well does your system automatically track, identify, and alert users to key obligations, including status updates and milestone-triggered workflows?

choices.text: No systematic obligation tracking
Manual list of key obligations without system support
Basic obligation tracking with limited automation
Good automated obligation identification with status tracking
Comprehensive automated tracking with sophisticated notification rules and workflow triggers for all key obligations and milestones

elements.name: stage6_integration_with_enterprise_systems_1
elements.title: How extensively does your CLM system connect with other enterprise systems through APIs, connectors, or built-in integration platforms?

choices.text: No integration with other enterprise systems
Basic manual data exchange with limited systems
Moderate integration with key systems using basic connectors
Good API-based integration with most enterprise systems
Comprehensive integration ecosystem with APIs, pre-built connectors, and iPaaS options connecting to all key adjacent systems

elements.name: stage6_data_1st_capability_2
elements.title: To what degree does your system treat the data within contracts as the primary unit of information rather than the document itself?

choices.text: Document-centric approach with minimal structured data
Basic metadata but primarily document-focused
Moderate structured data extraction with document-oriented storage
Good data extraction with both document and data accessibility
True data-first architecture where contract data is the primary information unit with robust data hierarchy and relationships

elements.name: stage6_milestone_tracking_3
elements.title: How comprehensively does your system monitor key contract events and automatically trigger appropriate workflows or notifications?

choices.text: No systematic milestone tracking
Basic date tracking requiring manual monitoring
Automated reminders for key dates without workflow integration
Good milestone monitoring with basic workflow triggers
Comprehensive automated monitoring with sophisticated notification rules and workflow initiation for all key events

elements.name: stage6_obligation_tracking_4
elements.title: To what extent does your system automatically identify and expose key obligations by all counterparties to contracts?

choices.text: No systematic tracking of counterparty obligations
Manual identification of major counterparty commitments
Basic tracking of key counterparty obligations with limited automation
Good automated identification of most counterparty obligations
Comprehensive automated identification and tracking of all counterparty obligations across the contract portfolio

elements.name: stage6_contract_hierarchy_and_relationship_mapping_5
elements.title: How effectively does your system present related contracts to ensure users have a complete view of dependencies and relationships?

choices.text: No relationship tracking between contracts
Manual notation of basic relationships
Standard relationship types with manual association
Good automated relationship identification with basic visualization
Comprehensive hierarchy and relationship mapping with user-friendly visualization of all dependencies

elements.name: stage6_legal_entity_management_6
elements.title: How well does your system support configurable entity creation and tracking to enable contract aggregation at the entity level?

choices.text: No entity management capabilities
Basic list of entities without systematic association to contracts
Standard entity records with manual contract association
Good entity management with reliable contract linkage
Comprehensive user-configurable entity management enabling sophisticated aggregation and analysis at entity level

elements.name: stage6_esg_compliance_7
elements.title: How well does your system support monitoring and reporting for internal guidelines or external regulations related to Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) goals?

choices.text: No ESG-specific capabilities
Manual tracking of basic ESG commitments with no systematic approach
Standardized ESG clauses but limited monitoring or reporting
Good ESG clause library with basic monitoring and reporting capabilities
Comprehensive, configurable ESG compliance monitoring with automated clause implementation and sophisticated reporting
